title: AFC Săgeata Năvodari
text:
Săgeata Năvodari was a <a href="Romania">Romania</a>n professional <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="football%20team">club</a> from <a href="N%C4%83vodari">Năvodari</a>, <a href="Constan%C5%A3a%20County">Constanţa County</a>, <a href="Romania">Romania</a>, founded in 2010 and dissolved in 2015.
History.
At the end of July 2010 the investors of <a href="AS%20S%C4%83geata%20Stejaru">AS Săgeata Stejaru</a> decided to leave <a href="Stejaru%2C%20Tulcea">Stejaru</a> and founded a new club in <a href="N%C4%83vodari">Năvodari</a>, named "AFC Săgeata Năvodari". Thus continuing the football tradition in Năvodari after the dissolution of <a href="CS%20N%C4%83vodari">CS Năvodari</a>, former "Midia Năvodari".
Săgeata finished 2nd in the series the first half of the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Liga%20II">2010–11 Liga II</a> season, and was in the battle for the promotion with <a href="Ceahl%C4%83ul%20Piatra%20Neam%C5%A3">Ceahlăul Piatra Neamţ</a> and <a href="Concordia%20Chiajna">Concordia Chiajna</a>. By the end of the season Săgeata targeted the first two places but failed to reach them and finished the championship 3rd. But all was not lost, because FRF decided that a play-off round will be played between <a href="Voin%C5%A3a%20Sibiu">Voinţa Sibiu</a> and <a href="S%C4%83geata%20N%C4%83vodari">Săgeata Năvodari</a> for the last vacant place in the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Liga%20I">2011–12 Liga I</a>.
Săgeata lost the play-off round against Voinţa Sibiu with aggregate score of 0–2.
Săgeata started fairly well the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Liga%20II">2011–12 Liga II</a>, ranking 3rd in the table after 11 rounds, just 4 points behind 2nd placed <a href="FC%20Delta%20Tulcea">FC Delta Tulcea</a>. The battle for promotion was fierce, with <a href="FC%20Viitorul%20Constan%C5%A3a">FC Viitorul Constanţa</a> and <a href="FC%20Delta%20Tulcea">FC Delta Tulcea</a> as opponents. In the end <a href="CSMS%20Ia%C5%9Fi">CSMS Iaşi</a> won the series, Săgeata ranking 4th, 12 points behind 2nd placed <a href="FC%20Viitorul%20Constan%C5%A3a">FC Viitorul Constanţa</a>.
The objective for the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Liga%20II">2012–13 season</a> is once again the promotion to the <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a>, this time the main opponents being <a href="CS%20Otopeni">CS Otopeni</a>, <a href="Sportul%20Studen%C8%9Besc%20Bucure%C8%99ti">Sportul Studențesc București</a> and <a href="Delta%20Tulcea">Delta Tulcea</a>.
The team finally promoted to the <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a> in 2013, after it finished 2nd in the series, 7 points behind <a href="FC%20Boto%C8%99ani">FC Botoșani</a>.
The objective for the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Liga%20I">2013–14 Liga I</a> season was to avoid relegation, but the club failed to achieve it. It started in the season in the <a href="Liga%20II">Liga II</a>, but during the winter break, it went bankrupt and was dissolved.
Stadium.
In the Liga II Săgeata played its home matches on the <a href="Stadionul%20Petromidia">Petromidia Stadium</a>, but after the promotion to the Liga I it had to move to nearby <a href="Stadionul%20Farul">Farul Stadium</a>, because its own stadium did not met the Liga I requirements.
Honours.
 <a href="Liga%20II">Liga II</a>
